intro: Polyosma brachystachys, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed polyosma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round berries. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
